alert.note: Alert for McDowell; Mingo; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 10:35PM EDT until July 13 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT WEDNESDAY FOR BUCHANAN, MCDOWELL, SOUTHEASTERN MINGO AND WYOMING COUNTIES... At 1035 PM EDT, Local law enforcement reported widespread flooding and road closures in the warning area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in Buchanan County, Virginia. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Welch, Grundy, Pineville, Mullens, Oceana, Gary, War, Northfork, Hanover, R.d. Bailey Lake, Gilbert Creek, Big Rock, Gilbert, Davy, Bradshaw, Iaeger, Keystone, Anawalt, Kimball and Avondale. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
